definitions.example: The leftfielder makes a nice snatch to end the inning.

definitions.definition: A competitive weightlifting event in which a barbell is lifted from the platform to locked arms overhead in a smooth continuous movement.
A piece of some sound, usually music or conversation.
definitions.example: I heard a snatch of Mozart as I passed the open window.

definitions.definition: A hasty snack; a bite to eat.
To attempt to seize something suddenly.
To take or seize hastily, abruptly, or without permission or ceremony.

definitions.example: Someone has just snatched my purse!

definitions.definition: (by extension) To take (a victory) at the last moment.
To do something quickly in the limited time available.
definitions.example: He snatched a glimpse of her while her mother had her back turned.
